hints.content:
First, let's find the area and perimeter of the striped rectangle.  

[[☃ image 1]]

We can find area of a rectangle by multiplying its length by its width.  
Area $= \greenD2 \times \greenD9 = \greenD{18} \text{ sq cm}$ 

We find perimeter by adding the lengths of the sides.  
Perimeter $= \greenD2 + \greenD2 + \greenD9 + \greenD9 = \greenD{22} \text{ cm}$

options.alt: A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 2 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 9 centimeters. !

hints.content:
Next, we find the area and perimeter of the other rectangle. 

$$ | Area | Perimeter
:- | :- | :-
![A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 2 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 9 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a3a0937efdcbcac4c0e5a5696662dbdc2ddda5be)| $\greenD2 \times \greenD9 = \greenD{18} \text{ sq cm}$  | $\greenD2 + \greenD2 + \greenD9 + \greenD9 = \greenD{22} \text{ cm}$
![A tall rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 7 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 4 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b86287cf6228ae599b1f40c3ded72b4ad080c4e) | $\blueD4 \!\times\!\! \blueD{7} \!=\!\! \blueD{28} \text{ sq cm}$   | $\blueD4 \!+\!\! \blueD4 \!+\!\! \blueD{7} \!+\!\! \blueD{7} \!=\!\! \blueD{22} \text{ cm}$

Now, lets compare the area and perimeters of the rectangles.

Area:  
$\greenD{18}\text { sq cm}\neq\blueD{28}\text{ sq cm}$

Perimeter:  
$\greenD{22}\text { cm}=\blueD{22}\text{ cm}$
The rectangles have the same perimeter only.
